intro: Hieracium subepitholotum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in various environments.
